title: Enhancing and visualizing product in APD in PolicyCenter
sourceFile: Enhancing and visualizing product in APD in PolicyCenter.docx

bodyParagraphs.text: Overview of the Visualization Phase
After you have conceptualized the business requirements in a mind map, and the mind
map has reached a level of stability, use Advanced Product Designer to import the mind
map in Policycenter.
Advanced Product Designer creates a visualized product in PolicyCenter. The visualization
phase focuses on:
Visualizing product in PolicyCenter
Making enhancements to the visualized product in PolicyCenter
Simulating policy transactions by navigating through product screens, to get
the look and feel of the product
Sharing and reviewing the visualized product with team members
Steps 1
Creating Visualized Products
1. Create a visualized product by importing the product mind map in PolicyCenter.
2. Edit or update visualized products in Policycenter.
Steps 2
Enhancing Visualized Products
1. Set product model properties such as:
a. Field usage and clause availability
b. Default, minimum, and maximum values
2. Create editions based on an effective date.
3. Add pricing for visualizing the quote process.
Steps 3
Simulating Policy Transactions
1. Create submission and other policy transactions, and navigate through the product
screens to get a look and feel of the product.
Steps 4
Sharing and Reviewing the Visualized Product
1. The project team members can share and review the visualized product by exporting
the product template.
Product Design Modes in PolicyCenter
Advanced Product Designer adds a Product Design Mode setting to PolicyCenter. This
offers increasing levels of interaction with the visualized products.
Product Design Modes:
HIDDEN              USER		DESIGNER	    DEVELOPER
Visualized products are hidden on the New Submission screen.
The Product Management option in the Administration menu is hidden.
Steps to set Product Design Mode
Visualizing Product in PolicyCenter
Create Visualized Product
You can create a visualized product by:
Importing a mind map in Policycenter
Importing a product template in PolicyCenter
• A visualized product can be moved from one PolicyCenter environment to
another, by saving the visualized product to template and importing the
template to the other environment.
Steps to Import Mind Maps in PolicyCenter
Steps to Import Mind Maps with Additional Languages
Steps to Import a Product Template in PolicyCenter
Edit Visualized Product
You can edit a visualized product in Policycenter:
From the Product Definition screen
In a policy submission or other policy transaction
Steps to Edit Visualized Product from the Product Definition Screen
Steps to Edit Visualized Product in Policy Transactions
Update Visualized Product
You can update the visualized product from:
Mind map
Template
UPDATING FROM A MIND MAP                UPDATING FROM A TEMPLATE
New additions in the mind map + New additions in the visualized product on import
Name of a topic is changed in the mind map + New addition in the visualized product
on import
Marker for a topic is changed in the mind map + Date type of the field is changed in
the visualized product on import
Deletions in the mind map + Does not delete from the visualized product - Must be
deleted manually in the visualized product
Remove Visualized Product
You can remove the visualized product from Policycenter if:
The Product Design Mode is set to Developer.
There are no bound transactions on the product.
There are no policy transactions that cannot be automatically withdrawn.
(Policy transactions cannot be withdrawn if the user does not have withdraw
permission.)
Steps to Remove Visualized Product
Exercise:
Visualize the Simple Small Business product, by importing the mind map in PolicyCenter.
Demonstration: Visualized Product.mp4
Working with the Visualized Product in PolicyCenter
Product, Product Line, and Risk Object:

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IE73B8E8BD9D8527A669C7D7404A5495101A4156ED1EE4CC46619263DC5C73B5E/media/86996451/V11/lesson-3-a-enhancing-and-visualizing-products-with-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Product_Definition_Screen.png
Reference:
For more details, refer to the 'Products and product lines' topic in the 'Advanced Product Designer'
technical documentation.
Modifying Clauses:
In the visualized product, you can add additional information on clauses, such as:
• Availability
• Usage for clause terms
• Minimum, maximum, and default values for clause terms
• Pricing
• Metadata for product generation

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IE73B8E8BD9D8527A669C7D7404A5495101A4156ED1EE4CC46619263DC5C73B5E/media/86996451/V11/lesson-3-a-enhancing-and-visualizing-products-with-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Picture1.png
Modifying Subclauses:
In the Subclauses popup, you can:
Add a new or existing clause as a subclause
Unassign a subclause from its parent clause
Remove a subclause

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IE73B8E8BD9D8527A669C7D7404A5495101A4156ED1EE4CC46619263DC5C73B5E/media/86996451/V11/lesson-3-a-enhancing-and-visualizing-products-with-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Subclauses_popup.png
Modifying Clause Terms and Schedules:
Clause terms are attributes attached to coverages, exclusions, and conditic
Clause terms can be of the following types:
• Text
• True/False
. Number
• Decimal
• Monetary Amount
• Drop-down list
• Date-time
As seen in the screenshot below, on the Clause Terms popup you can:
• View/edit clause terms
• View/edit schedules under the Clause Schedule Terms listview

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IE73B8E8BD9D8527A669C7D7404A5495101A4156ED1EE4CC46619263DC5C73B5E/media/86996451/V11/lesson-3-a-enhancing-and-visualizing-products-with-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/ClauseTerms_popup.png
Enhancing Visualized Product: Overview
Some product details must be entered directly in PolicyCenter. The details include:
Usage Properties — minimums, maximum, and default values
Usage Properties — usage and availability
Parts of pricing
In the mind map, these details can be documented in notes, but are dropped when the
mind map is imported in PolicyCenter.
The following lessons describe how to model product details in Advanced Product Designer
screens.
Steps 1
Analyzing Business Requirements from the Mind Map
1. Refer to notes from the mind map for adding product model properties such as:
a. Field usage or clause availability
b. Default, minimum, maximum values
Steps 2
Enhancing Visualized Product in PolicyCenter
1. Enhance the visualized product by adding the product model properties on the
Product Definition screens in PolicyCenter.
Enhancing Drop-down lists in Visualized Product
In Advanced Product Designer:
New drop-down lists can be defined in visualized products.
Drop-down list items can be added, removed, and modified.
Drop-down lists defined in the current product can be referenced elsewhere in this product.
In the Developer mode, drop-down lists defined in Policycenter can be accessed.
Steps to Link Drop-down Lists that Reference Other Lists in the Current Product:
Steps to Link Drop-down List to PolicyCenter Typelist: For example — Jurisdiction
Instructor Exercise:
Enhance the drop-down lists in the visualized product, based on the succeed Insurance
business requirements and notes from the mind map.
Demonstration: Enhancing Drop-down .mp4
Enhancing Product Model Properties - Usage and Availability
You can use the notes added during product conceptualization in the mind map, to
manually add usage and availability properties to the visualized product in PolicyCenter.
In the visualized product, you can specify usage and availability properties for:
Fields
Clauses
Clause terms
Drop-down lists
FIELD USAGE				CLAUSE AVAILABILITY
For fields, you can specify the following in Field Usage that the field is:
Derived — Value is derived programmatically and is read-only in the user interface.
Hidden — Value is stored in the database but is not displayed to the user.
Unavailable — The field is not available and cannot be added to the policy.
User Entered — Value is entered by the user.
User Entered: Required for Bind - Value is entered by the user and is required to bind the policy-
User Entered: Required for Issue — Value is entered by the user and is required for issuance-
User Entered: Required for Quote — Value is entered by the user and is required
Exercise:
Add the usage and availability product model properties in the visualized product, based
on the Succeed Insurance business requirements and notes from the mind map.
Demonstration: Enhancing Product Model .mp4
Enhancing Product Model Properties - Default, Minimum, Maximum Values
On the Product Definition screen, or on the Risk Details screen in a submission or any
other policy transaction, you can specify:
Default values for:
o Fields
Exposure fields
o Clause terms
o Drop-down lists
• Minimum and maximum values for:
o Numeric fields and exposure fields
o Numeric and option clause terms
You cannot specify minimum and maximum values for clause terms of type package or typelist, and
for drop-down lists on fields and exposure fields-
Steps to Add Default Value
Subclauses with numeric and option clause terms
When specifying minimum and maximum values for numeric and option clause terms          for
a parent clause, the values can be calculated or fixed.
• Numeric clause terms - The minimum or maximum values can be fixed and calculated.
Option clause terms - The minimum or maximum values can only be calculated.
Note:
You cannot add Conditional Exceptions to option clause terms.
Steps to Add Minimum or Maximum Value for Numeric or Option Clause Terms
Restrictions on clauses and clause terms referenced in calculations
Clauses and clause terms that are referenced in calculated values of minimum and
maximum values have the following restrictions:
. Removal
o You cannot remove a clause if any of its terms, including the terms of its
subclauses, is referenced in a calculated value.
o You cannot remove a clause term that is referenced in a calculated value.
• Change type
o You cannot change the type of a clause term if it is referenced in a calculated value.
o You cannot change the type of a parent clause term if its minimum or maximum
value is calculated.
• Unassign clause
o You cannot unassign a clause from its parent clause if that clause or any of its
subclauses is referenced in a calculated value.
Exercise:
Add the default, minimum, and maximum values to the fields and clause terms in the
visualized product, based on the Succeed Insurance business requirements and notes from the mind map.
Demonstration: Enhancing Product Model Properties .mp4
Creating Editions
Editions define the product model properties and subclause (parent-child clause)
relationships for a product line.
You create editions in the visualized product line.
A product line can have multiple editions.
Editions have an effective date.
Effective date for each edition must be unique.
• In a policy transaction, PolicyCenter selects the edition based on the Effective
Date on the Policy Info screen.
Editions have no expiration date.
Each product line has a Base edition.
The Base edition contains the product model properties and subclause
relationships for the base product line.
The Base edition does not have an effective date.
Editions are cascaded.
Later editions inherit product model properties from previous editions.
Later editions override changes in

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IE73B8E8BD9D8527A669C7D7404A5495101A4156ED1EE4CC46619263DC5C73B5E/media/86996451/V11/lesson-3-a-enhancing-and-visualizing-products-with-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Editions_L3.vsdx.jpgtroduced in prior editions.
Creating Editions
You create new editions in the visualized product line. You can set the Product Design
Mode to Designer or above.
Steps to Create a New Edition
Steps to View or Change the Product Model Properties in an Existing Edition
Steps to Delete an Edition from a Visualized Product
Exercise:
Requirements: Creating Edition
Demonstration: Creating Editions.mp4
Accelerate Product Launch via Editions
With editions, you can load the following to an insurance product line after it has gone into
production, without restarting the server:
Changes to the product model properties:
o Field usage
o Clause availability
o Default, minimum, or maximum values
Changes to subclause relationships:
o Unassigninga subclause from its parent clause
o Adding an existing clause as a subclause
Adding pricing
In the visualized product, you can enter a rate in a policy transaction and see how that rate
affects the policy premium.
In the visualized product, you can specify the pricing details in:
The Product definition screen
• Pricing is a tab on the prduct screen and the riskobject screen
In a submission or other policy transaction
Pricing is a step during submission
Costs have a Rate column
Adding Costs in pricing:

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IE73B8E8BD9D8527A669C7D7404A5495101A4156ED1EE4CC46619263DC5C73B5E/media/86996451/V11/lesson-3-a-enhancing-and-visualizing-products-with-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Pricing.jpg
Exercise:
Add the pricing details in the visualized product, based on the succeed Insurance business
requirements and notes from the mind map.
Demonstration: Adding pricing.mp4
